dublinCore.dc:title: 113 SRES 450 ATS: Designating May 17, 2014, as ‘‘Kids to Parks Day’’.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Udall of Colorado (for himself, Ms. Landrieu, Mr. Portman, and Mr. Wyden) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Designating May 17, 2014, as ‘‘Kids to Parks Day’’.

whereas.text: Whereas the 4th annual Kids to Parks Day will be celebrated on May 17, 2014;
Whereas the goal of Kids to Parks Day is to empower young people and encourage families to get outdoors and visit the parks of the United States;
Whereas communities across the United States offer a variety of natural resources and public land, often with free access, to individuals seeking outdoor recreation;
Whereas the people of the United States, young and old, should be encouraged to lead more healthy and active lifestyles;
Whereas Kids to Parks Day is an opportunity for families to take a break from their busy lives and come together for a day of wholesome fun; and
Whereas Kids to Parks Day will broaden the appreciation of young people for nature and the outdoors: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: designates May 17, 2014, as Kids to Parks Day;
recognizes the importance of outdoor recreation and the preservation of open spaces to the health of the young people of the United States; and
calls on the people of the United States to observe the day with appropriate programs, ceremonies, and activities.
